newsitem.title: INDIA: JP Morgan to invest $6.3 mln in HCL Comnet.
newsitem.headline: JP Morgan to invest $6.3 mln in HCL Comnet.

text.p: India's HCL Comnet Systems and Services Ltd HCCL.BO said on Thursday JP Morgan Capital Corp, a wholly owned subsidiary of JP Morgan and Co, will buy 19.66 percent of its shares at a total cost of 225 million rupees ($6.3 million).
The purchase will be made at a premium of 80 rupees per share, the statement said. HCL Comnet is part of India's HCL group.

The investment will be used to fund the expansion of HCL Comnet's existing VSAT-based communications infrastructure by setting up an enterprise-wide satellite communications network, the statement said.
The network will facilitate a broad range of banking and financial applications, including electronic funds transfer and electronic data interchange, the statement said. ($1 = 35.8 rupees)
